name: The Drop (jd.min)
description:
The Drop is an experimental FPS that combines music into the gameplay.  It all started with a crazy idea - what if you have to match the beats to shoot in a FPS? Neutralize the opponent by shooting them with your rhythm skills and dominate the crossfader to earn scores. You select a pair of songs each round and the music will be mixed according to the position of the crossfader in real time.

The game supports only local 1 vs 1 now and you need at least one controller in addition to the keyboard & mouse to play against each other. 

This game was developed as a student pitch project of Entertainment Technology Center, Carnegie Mellon University. 

http://www.etc.cmu.edu/projects/the-drop/

Controls

When only 1 controller is connected, Player 1 uses the controller and Player 2 uses keyboard/mouse.

When 2 controllers are connected, both players use each controller.

Keyboard - WASD to move, Mouse movement to look around, Space to jump, Left/Right Mouse Click to shoot

Controller - Left Stick to move, Right Stick to look around, A to Jump, Left/Right Trigger to shoot
